screaminggoat at 2024-07-01T19:32:48.711Z ##

Do you like Splunk? Do you like them enough to read 18* security advisories?

  1. SVD-2024-0701 Missing CVE ID (8.8 high) Remote Code Execution through dashboard PDF generation component
  2. SVD-2024-0702 CVE-2024-36982 (7.5 high) Denial of Service through null pointer reference in cluster/config REST endpoint
  3. SVD-2024-0703 CVE-2024-36983 (8.0 high) Command Injection using External Lookups
  4. SVD-2024-0704 CVE-2024-36984 (8.8 high) Remote Code Execution through Serialized Session Payload in Splunk Enterprise on Windows
  5. SVD-2024-0705 CVE-2024-36985 (8.8 high) Remote Code Execution (RCE) through an external lookup due to "copybuckets.py" script in the "splunk_archiver" application in Splunk Enterprise
  6. SVD-2024-0706 CVE-2024-36986 (6.3 medium) Risky command safeguards bypass through Search ID query in Analytics Workspace
  7. SVD-2024-0707 CVE-2024-36987 (4.3 medium) Insecure File Upload in the indexing/preview REST endpoint
  8. SVD-2024-0708 No CVE ID, informational only: OpenSSL crypto library (libcrypto.so) incorrectly compiled with stack execution bit set in Splunk Enterprise and Universal Forwarder on certain operating systems
  9. SVD-2024-0709 CVE-2024-36989 (6.5 medium) Low-privileged user could create notifications in Splunk Web Bulletin Messages
  10. SVD-2024-0710 CVE-2024-36990 (6.5 medium) Denial of Service (DoS) on the datamodel/web REST endpoint
  11. SVD-2024-0711 CVE-2024-36991 (7.5 high) Path Traversal on the "/modules/messaging/" endpoint in Splunk Enterprise on Windows (cc: @reverseics)
  12. SVD-2024-0712 CVE-2024-36992 (5.4 medium) Persistent Cross-site Scripting (XSS) in Dashboard Elements
  13. SVD-2024-0713 CVE-2024-36993 (5.4 medium) Persistent Cross-site Scripting (XSS) in Web Bulletin
  14. SVD-2024-0714 CVE-2024-36994 (5.4 medium) Persistent Cross-site Scripting (XSS) in Dashboard Elements
  15. SVD-2024-0715 CVE-2024-36995 (4.3 medium) Low-privileged user could create experimental items
  16. SVD-2024-0716 CVE-2024-36996 (5.3 medium) Information Disclosure of user names
  17. SVD-2024-0717 CVE-2024-36997 (4.6 medium) Persistent Cross-site Scripting (XSS) in conf-web/settings REST endpoint
  18. SVD-2024-0718 Third-Party Package Updates in Splunk Enterprise - July 2024 (23 vulnerabilities, unknown exploitation and CVSS score statuses)

No mention of exploitation. h/t for @cR0w for the last 2 CVE IDs (I relied specifically on the RSS feed entries).

updated 2024-07-01T18:32:48

2 posts

The vulnerability requires the authenticated user to phish the victim by tricking them into initia

  1. SVD-2024-0701 Missing CVE ID (8.8 high) Remote Code Execution through dashboard PDF generation component
  2. SVD-2024-0702 CVE-2024-36982 (7.5 high) Denial of Service through null pointer reference in cluster/config REST endpoint
  3. SVD-2024-0703 CVE-2024-36983 (8.0 high) Command Injection using External Lookups
  4. SVD-2024-0704 CVE-2024-36984 (8.8 high) Remote Code Execution through Serialized Session Payload in Splunk Enterprise on Windows
  5. SVD-2024-0705 CVE-2024-36985 (8.8 high) Remote Code Execution (RCE) through an external lookup due to "copybuckets.py" script in the "splunk_archiver" application in Splunk Enterprise
  6. SVD-2024-0706 CVE-2024-36986 (6.3 medium) Risky command safeguards bypass through Search ID query in Analytics Workspace
  7. SVD-2024-0707 CVE-2024-36987 (4.3 medium) Insecure File Upload in the indexing/preview REST endpoint
  8. SVD-2024-0708 No CVE ID, informational only: OpenSSL crypto library (libcrypto.so) incorrectly compiled with stack execution bit set in Splunk Enterprise and Universal Forwarder on certain operating systems
  9. SVD-2024-0709 CVE-2024-36989 (6.5 medium) Low-privileged user could create notifications in Splunk Web Bulletin Messages
  10. SVD-2024-0710 CVE-2024-36990 (6.5 medium) Denial of Service (DoS) on the datamodel/web REST endpoint
  11. SVD-2024-0711 CVE-2024-36991 (7.5 high) Path Traversal on the "/modules/messaging/" endpoint in Splunk Enterprise on Windows (cc: @reverseics)
  12. SVD-2024-0712 CVE-2024-36992 (5.4 medium) Persistent Cross-site Scripting (XSS) in Dashboard Elements
  13. SVD-2024-0713 CVE-2024-36993 (5.4 medium) Persistent Cross-site Scripting (XSS) in Web Bulletin
  14. SVD-2024-0714 CVE-2024-36994 (5.4 medium) Persistent Cross-site Scripting (XSS) in Dashboard Elements
  15. SVD-2024-0715 CVE-2024-36995 (4.3 medium) Low-privileged user could create experimental items
  16. SVD-2024-0716 CVE-2024-36996 (5.3 medium) Information Disclosure of user names
  17. SVD-2024-0717 CVE-2024-36997 (4.6 medium) Persistent Cross-site Scripting (XSS) in conf-web/settings REST endpoint
  18. SVD-2024-0718 Third-Party Package Updates in Splunk Enterprise - July 2024 (23 vulnerabilities, unknown exploitation and CVSS score statuses)

No mention of exploitation. h/t for @cR0w for the last 2 CVE IDs (I relied specifically on the RSS feed entries).

##

CVE-2024-36984
(8.8 HIGH)

EPSS: 0.04%

updated 2024-07-01T18:32:48

2 posts

In Splunk Enterprise versions below 9.2.2, 9.1.5, and 9.0.10 on Windows, an authenticated user could execute a specially crafted query that they could then use to serialize untrusted data. The attacker could use the query to execute arbitrary code.

CVE-2024-36996
(5.3 MEDIUM)

EPSS: 0.04%

updated 2024-07-01T18:32:48

2 posts

In Splunk Enterprise versions below 9.2.2, 9.1.5, and 9.0.10 and Splunk Cloud Platform versions below 9.1.2312.109, an attacker could determine whether or not another user exists on the instance by deciphering the error response that they would likely receive from the instance when they attempt to log in. This disclosure could then lead to additional brute-force password-guessing attacks. This vul

1 repos

  18. SVD-2024-0718 Third-Party Package Updates in Splunk Enterprise - July 2024 (23 vulnerabilities, unknown exploitation and CVSS score statuses)

No mention of exploitation. h/t for @cR0w for the last 2 CVE IDs (I relied specifically on the RSS feed entries).

#PatchTuesday #Splunk #vulnerability #CVE

##

CVE-2024-36994
(5.4 MEDIUM)

EPSS: 0.04%

updated 2024-07-01T18:32:48

2 posts

In Splunk Enterprise versions below 9.2.2, 9.1.5, and 9.0.10 and Splunk Cloud Platform versions below 9.1.2312.200 and 9.1.2308.207, a low-privileged user that does not hold the admin or power Splunk roles could craft a malicious payload through a View and Splunk Web Bulletin Messages that could result in execution of unauthorized JavaScript code in the browser of a user.

1 repos

#search_error

screaminggoat at 2024-07-01T19:32:48.711Z ##

Do you like Splunk? Do you like them enough to read 18* security advisories?

  1. SVD-2024-0701 Missing CVE ID (8.8 high) Remote Code Execution through dashboard PDF generation component
  2. SVD-2024-0702 CVE-2024-36982 (7.5 high) Denial of Service through null pointer reference in cluster/config REST endpoint
  3. SVD-2024-0703 CVE-2024-36983 (8.0 high) Command Injection using External Lookups
  4. SVD-2024-0704 CVE-2024-36984 (8.8 high) Remote Code Execution through Serialized Session Payload in Splunk Enterprise on Windows
  5. SVD-2024-0705 CVE-2024-36985 (8.8 high) Remote Code Execution (RCE) through an external lookup due to "copybuckets.py" script in the "splunk_archiver" application in Splunk Enterprise
  6. SVD-2024-0706 CVE-2024-36986 (6.3 medium) Risky command safeguards bypass through Search ID query in Analytics Workspace
  7. SVD-2024-0707 CVE-2024-36987 (4.3 medium) Insecure File Upload in the indexing/preview REST endpoint
  8. SVD-2024-0708 No CVE ID, informational only: OpenSSL crypto library (libcrypto.so) incorrectly compiled with stack execution bit set in Splunk Enterprise and Universal Forwarder on certain operating systems
  9. SVD-2024-0709 CVE-2024-36989 (6.5 medium) Low-privileged user could create notifications in Splunk Web Bulletin Messages
  10. SVD-2024-0710 CVE-2024-36990 (6.5 medium) Denial of Service (DoS) on the datamodel/web REST endpoint
  11. SVD-2024-0711 CVE-2024-36991 (7.5 high) Path Traversal on the "/modules/messaging/" endpoint in Splunk Enterprise on Windows (cc: @reverseics)
  12. SVD-2024-0712 CVE-2024-36992 (5.4 medium) Persistent Cross-site Scripting (XSS) in Dashboard Elements
  13. SVD-2024-0713 CVE-2024-36993 (5.4 medium) Persistent Cross-site Scripting (XSS) in Web Bulletin

##

CVE-2024-36997
(8.1 HIGH)

EPSS: 0.04%

updated 2024-07-01T18:32:48

2 posts

In Splunk Enterprise versions below 9.2.2, 9.1.5, and 9.0.10 and Splunk Cloud Platform versions below 9.1.2312, an admin user could store and execute arbitrary JavaScript code in the browser context of another Splunk user through the conf-web/settings REST endpoint. This could potentially cause a persistent cross-site scripting (XSS) exploit.

screaminggoat at 2024-07-01T19:32:48.711Z ##

Do you like Splunk? Do you like them enough to read 18* security advisories?

  1. SVD-2024-0701 Missing CVE ID (8.8 high) Remote Code Execution through dashboard PDF generation component
  2. SVD-2024-0702 CVE-2024-36982 (7.5 high) Denial of Service through null pointer reference in cluster/config REST endpoint

CVE-2024-36987
(4.3 MEDIUM)

EPSS: 0.04%

updated 2024-07-01T18:32:48

2 posts

In Splunk Enterprise versions below 9.2.2, 9.1.5, and 9.0.10 and Splunk Cloud Platform versions below 9.1.2312.200, an authenticated, low-privileged user who does not hold the admin or power Splunk roles could upload a file with an arbitrary extension using the indexing/preview REST endpoint.

##

CVE-2024-36991
(7.5 HIGH)

EPSS: 0.04%

updated 2024-07-01T18:32:48

2 posts

In Splunk Enterprise on Windows versions below 9.2.2, 9.1.5, and 9.0.10, an attacker could perform a path traversal on the /modules/messaging/ endpoint in Splunk Enterprise on Windows. This vulnerability should only affect Splunk Enterprise on Windows.

4 repos

https://github.com/sardine-web/CVE-2024-36991

https://github.com/Mr-xn/CVE-2024-36991

https://github.com/bigb0x/CVE-2024-36991

https://github.com/th3gokul/CVE-2024-36991

screaminggoat at 2024-07-01T19:32:48.711Z ##

Do you like Splunk? Do you like them enough to read 18* security advisories?

  1. SVD-2024-0701 Missing CVE ID (8.8 high) Remote Code Execution through dashboard PDF generation component
  2. SVD-2024-0702 CVE-2024-36982 (7.5 high) Denial of Service through null pointer reference in cluster/config REST endpoint
  3. SVD-2024-0703 CVE-2024-36983 (8.0 high) Command Injection using External Lookups
  4. SVD-2024-0704 CVE-2024-36984 (8.8 high) Remote Code Execution through Serialized Session Payload in Splunk Enterprise on Windows
  5. SVD-2024-0705 CVE-2024-36985 (8.8 high) Remote Code Execution (RCE) through an external lookup due to "copybuckets.py" script in the "splunk_archiver" application in Splunk Enterprise
  6. SVD-2024-0706 CVE-2024-36986 (6.3 medium) Risky command safeguards bypass through Search ID query in Analytics Workspace
  7. SVD-2024-0707 CVE-2024-36987 (4.3 medium) Insecure File Upload in the indexing/preview REST endpoint
  8. SVD-2024-0708 No CVE ID, informational only: OpenSSL crypto library (libcrypto.so) incorrectly compiled with stack execution bit set in Splunk Enterprise and Universal Forwarder on certain operating systems
  9. SVD-2024-0709 CVE-2024-36989 (6.5 medium) Low-privileged user could create notifications in Splunk Web Bulletin Messages
  10. SVD-2024-0710 CVE-2024-36990 (6.5 medium) Denial of Service (DoS) on the datamodel/web REST endpoint
  11. SVD-2024-0711 CVE-2024-36991 (7.5 high) Path Traversal on the "/modules/messaging/" endpoint in Splunk Enterprise on Windows (cc: @reverseics)
  12. SVD-2024-0712 CVE-2024-36992 (5.4 medium) Persistent Cross-site Scripting (XSS) in Dashboard Elements
  13. SVD-2024-0713 CVE-2024-36993 (5.4 medium) Persistent Cross-site Scripting (XSS) in Web Bulletin
  14. SVD-2024-0714 CVE-2024-36994 (5.4 medium) Persistent Cross-site Scripting (XSS) in Dashboard Elements
  15. SVD-2024-0715 CVE-2024-36995 (4.3 medium) Low-privileged user could create experimental items
  16. SVD-2024-0716 CVE-2024-36996 (5.3 medium) Information Disclosure of user names
  17. SVD-2024-0717 CVE-2024-36997 (4.6 medium) Persistent Cross-site Scripting (XSS) in conf-web/settings REST endpoint
  18. SVD-2024-0718 Third-Party Package Updates in Splunk Enterprise - July 2024 (23 vulnerabilities, unknown exploitation and CVSS score statuses)

No mention of exploitation. h/t for @cR0w for the last 2 CVE IDs (I relied specifically on the RSS feed entries).

##

CVE-2024-36983
(8.0 HIGH)

EPSS: 0.04%

updated 2024-07-01T18:32:48

2 posts

In Splunk Enterprise versions below 9.2.2, 9.1.5, and 9.0.10 and Splunk Cloud Platform versions below 9.1.2312.109 and 9.1.2308.207, an authenticated user could create an external lookup that calls a legacy internal function. The authenticated user could use this internal function to insert code into the Splunk platform installation directory. From there, the user could execute arbitrary code on t

screaminggoat at 2024-07-01T19:32:48.711Z ##

Do you like Splunk? Do you like them enough to read 18* security advisories?

  1. SVD-2024-0701 Missing CVE ID (8.8 high) Remote Code Execution through dashboard PDF generation component
  2. SVD-2024-0702 CVE-2024-36982 (7.5 high) Denial of Service through null pointer reference in cluster/config REST endpoint

##

CVE-2024-20399
(6.0 MEDIUM)

EPSS: 0.25%

updated 2024-07-01T18:32:47

26 posts

A vulnerability in the CLI of Cisco NX-OS Software could allow an authenticated, local attacker to execute arbitrary commands as root on the underlying operating system of an affected device. This vulnerability is due to insufficient validation of arguments that are passed to specific configuration CLI commands. An attacker could exploit this vulnerability by including crafted input as the argum

1 repos

https://github.com/Blootus/CVE-2024-20399-Cisco-RCE

screaminggoat at 2024-07-02T14:37:38.119Z ##

CISA: CISA Adds One Known Exploited Vulnerability to Catalog
Hot off the press! CISA adds Cisco zero-day CVE-2024-20399 to the KEV Catalog!
See parent toots above for security advisory, Sygnia threat intelligence information, etc.

cc: @campuscodi @briankrebs @cR0w @mttaggart @jerry

#zeroday #kev #knownexploitedvulnerabilitiescatalog #cisa #cisco #vulnerability #CVE_2024_20399 #eitw #activeexploitation

##
screaminggoat at 2024-07-02T12:32:08.263Z ##

Sygnia: China-Nexus Threat Group Velvet Ant Exploits Cisco Zero-Day (CVE-2024-20399) to Compromise Nexus Switch Devices Advisory for Mitigation and Response

Sygnia identified that CVE-2024-20399 was exploited in the wild by a China-nexus threat group as a zero-day and shared the details of the vulnerability with Cisco. By exploiting this vulnerability, a threat group dubbed Velvet Ant successfully executed commands on the underlying operating system of Cisco Nexus devices. This exploitation led to the execution of a previously unknown custom malware that allowed the threat group to remotely connect to compromised Cisco Nexus devices, upload additional files, and execute code on the devices.

See parent toot above for the Cisco security advisory. cc: @campuscodi @briankrebs @cR0w @mttaggart @jerry

#CVE_2024_20399 #eitw #activeexploitation #zeroday #vulnerability #CVE #Cisco

##
screaminggoat at 2024-07-01T17:14:04.825Z ##

just in time to celebrate infosec.exchange returning, Cisco zero day: Cisco NX-OS Software CLI Command Injection Vulnerability
CVE-2024-20399 (6.0 medium) A vulnerability in the CLI of Cisco NX-OS Software could allow an authenticated, local attacker to execute arbitrary commands as root on the underlying operating system of an affected device. This vulnerability is due to insufficient validation of arguments that are passed to specific configuration CLI commands. An attacker could exploit this vulnerability by including crafted input as the argument of an affected configuration CLI command. A successful exploit could allow the attacker to execute arbitrary commands on the underlying operating system with the privileges of root. Note: To successfully exploit this vulnerability on a Cisco NX-OS device, an attacker must have Administrator credentials.

In April 2024, the Cisco Product Security Incident Response Team (PSIRT) became aware of attempted exploitation of this vulnerability in the wild.

EDIT: Sygnia links attempted zero-day exploitation to Chinese state-sponsored threat actor it tracks as Velvet Ant (no article yet). See related Bleeping Computer reporting; Cisco warns of NX-OS zero-day exploited to deploy custom malware

cc: @campuscodi @briankrebs @cR0w @mttaggart

#CVE_2024_20399 #vulnerability #zeroday #cisco #cve #eitw #cyberespionage #velvetant #china

##
screaminggoat@infosec.exchange at 2024-07-02T14:37:38.000Z ##

CISA: CISA Adds One Known Exploited Vulnerability to Catalog
Hot off the press! CISA adds Cisco zero-day CVE-2024-20399 to the KEV Catalog!
See parent toots above for security advisory, Sygnia threat intelligence information, etc.

cc: @campuscodi @briankrebs @cR0w @mttaggart @jerry

Sygnia identified that CVE-2024-20399 was exploited in the wild by a China-nexus threat group as a zero-day and shared the details of the vulnerability with Cisco. By exploiting this vulnerability, a threat group dubbed Velvet Ant successfully executed commands on the underlying operating system of Cisco Nexus devices. This exploitation led to the execution of a previously unknown custom malware that allowed the threat group to remotely connect to compromised Cisco Nexus devices, upload additional files, and execute code on the devices.

See parent toot above for the Cisco security advisory. cc: @campuscodi @briankrebs @cR0w @mttaggart @jerry

CVE-2024-20399 (6.0 medium) A vulnerability in the CLI of Cisco NX-OS Software could allow an authenticated, local attacker to execute arbitrary commands as root on the underlying operating system of an affected device. This vulnerability is due to insufficient validation of arguments that are passed to specific configuration CLI commands. An attacker could exploit this vulnerability by including crafted input as the argument of an affected configuration CLI command. A successful exploit could allow the attacker to execute arbitrary commands on the underlying operating system with the privileges of root. Note: To successfully exploit this vulnerability on a Cisco NX-OS device, an attacker must have Administrator credentials.

In April 2024, the Cisco Product Security Incident Response Team (PSIRT) became aware of attempted exploitation of this vulnerability in the wild.

CVE-2024-20399 (6.0 medium) A vulnerability in the CLI of Cisco NX-OS Software could allow an authenticated, local attacker to execute arbitrary commands as root on the underlying operating system of an affected device. just in time to celebrate infosec.exchange returning, Cisco zero day: Cisco NX-OS Software CLI Command Injection Vulnerability
CVE-2024-20399 (6.0 medium) A vulnerability in the CLI of Cisco NX-OS Software could allow an authenticated, local attacker to execute arbitrary commands as root on the underlying operating system of an affected device. This vulnerability is due to insufficient validation of arguments that are passed to specific configuration CLI commands. An attacker could exploit this vulnerability by including crafted input as the argument of an affected configuration CLI command. A successful exploit could allow the attacker to execute arbitrary commands on the underlying operating system with the privileges of root. ##
jbhall56 at 2024-07-03T11:51:32.932Z ##

Tracked as CVE-2024-20399, the command injection vulnerability allows an authenticated local attacker to execute arbitrary commands as root. https://www.govinfosecurity.com/cisco-patches-exploited-zero-day-vulnerability-a-25682

##
screaminggoat at 2024-07-02T14:50:34.180Z ##

@jerry @campuscodi @briankrebs @cR0w @mttaggart https://www.sygnia.co/threat-reports-and-advisories/china-nexus-threat-group-velvet-ant-exploits-cisco-0-day/

CVE-2024-20399 that was identified by Sygnia allows an attacker with valid administrator credentials to the Switch management console to escape the NX-OS CLI and execute arbitrary commands on the Linux underlaying operating system.

https://www.bleepingcomputer.com/news/security/cisco-warns-of-nx-os-zero-day-exploited-to-deploy-custom-malware/

"The threat actors gathered administrator-level credentials to gain access to Cisco Nexus switches and deploy a previously unknown custom malware that allowed them to remotely connect to compromised devices, upload additional files and execute malicious code."

Post-compromise activity includes persistence for sure, but extended beyond that.

##
AAKL at 2024-07-02T14:21:38.576Z ##

Updated advisories on #CISA. #Infosec #cybersecurity

- - KEV catalogue listing: #Cisco NX-OS Command Injection Vulnerability CVE-2024-20399 https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2024-20399

- Seven Industrial Control Systems Advisories https://www.cisa.gov/news-events/alerts/2024/07/02/cisa-releases-seven-industrial-control-systems-advisories

Press release: CISA Releases the Marine Transportation System Resilience Assessment Guide https://www.cisa.gov/news-events/news/cisa-releases-marine-transportation-system-resilience-assessment-guide-0 @cisacyber

##
jbhall56@infosec.exchange at 2024-07-02T11:53:55.000Z ##

Tracked as CVE-2024-20399 (CVSS score of 6), the security defect impacts the command line interface of NX-OS and could allow a local attacker to execute arbitrary commands on the underlying operating system, with root privileges. https://www.securityweek.com/cisco-patches-nx-os-zero-day-exploited-by-chinese-cyberspies/

##
screaminggoat@infosec.exchange at 2024-07-01T20:19:14.000Z ##

@kpwn CVE Crowd showing a major community interest in CVE-2024-6387 #regreSSHion even though CVE-2024-20399 is a newly discovered Cisco zero-day linked to a Chinese state-sponsored actor #cvecrowddeny

##
screaminggoat@infosec.exchange at 2024-07-01T17:43:36.000Z ##

@jerry Cisco zero-day CVE-2024-20399 dropped at 12pm while infosec.exchange was down: https://sec.cloudapps.cisco.com/security/center/content/CiscoSecurityAdvisory/cisco-sa-nxos-cmd-injection-xD9OhyOP

EDIT: Sygnia links attempted zero-day exploitation to Chinese state-sponsored threat actor it tracks as Velvet Ant (no article yet). See related Bleeping Computer reporting; Cisco warns of NX-OS zero-day exploited to deploy custom malware

##

CVE-2024-36990
(6.5 MEDIUM)

EPSS: 0.04%

updated 2024-07-01T18:32:41

2 posts

In Splunk Enterprise versions below 9.2.2, 9.1.5, and 9.0.10 and Splunk Cloud Platform versions below 9.2.2403.100, an authenticated, low-privileged user that does not hold the admin or power Splunk roles could send a specially crafted HTTP POST request to the datamodel/web REST endpoint in Splunk Enterprise, potentially causing a denial of service.

screaminggoat at 2024-07-01T19:32:48.711Z ##

Do you like Splunk? Do you like them enough to read 18* security advisories?

  1. SVD-2024-0701 Missing CVE ID (8.8 high) Remote Code Execution through dashboard PDF generation component
  2. SVD-2024-0702 CVE-2024-36982 (7.5 high) Denial of Service through null pointer reference in cluster/config REST endpoint
  3. SVD-2024-0703 CVE-2024-36983 (8.0 high) Command Injection using External Lookups
  4. SVD-2024-0704 CVE-2024-36984 (8.8 high) Remote Code Execution through Serialized Session Payload in Splunk Enterprise on Windows
  5. SVD-2024-0705 CVE-2024-36985 (8.8 high) Remote Code Execution (RCE) through an external lookup due to "copybuckets.py" script in the "splunk_archiver" application in Splunk Enterprise
  6. SVD-2024-0706 CVE-2024-36986 (6.3 medium) Risky command safeguards bypass through Search ID query in Analytics Workspace
  7. SVD-2024-0707 CVE-2024-36987 (4.3 medium) Insecure File Upload in the indexing/preview REST endpoint
  8. SVD-2024-0708 No CVE ID, informational only: OpenSSL crypto library (libcrypto.so) incorrectly compiled with stack execution bit set in Splunk Enterprise and Universal Forwarder on certain operating systems
  9. SVD-2024-0709 CVE-2024-36989 (6.5 medium) Low-privileged user could create notifications in Splunk Web Bulletin Messages
  10. SVD-2024-0710 CVE-2024-36990 (6.5 medium) Denial of Service (DoS) on the datamodel/web REST endpoint
  11. SVD-2024-0711 CVE-2024-36991 (7.5 high) Path Traversal on the "/modules/messaging/" endpoint in Splunk Enterprise on Windows (cc: @reverseics)
  12. SVD-2024-0712 CVE-2024-36992 (5.4 medium) Persistent Cross-site Scripting (XSS) in Dashboard Elements
  13. SVD-2024-0713 CVE-2024-36993 (5.4 medium) Persistent Cross-site Scripting (XSS) in Web Bulletin
  14. SVD-2024-0714 CVE-2024-36994 (5.4 medium) Persistent Cross-site Scripting (XSS) in Dashboard Elements
  15. SVD-2024-0715 CVE-2024-36995 (4.3 medium) Low-privileged user could create experimental items
  16. SVD-2024-0716 CVE-2024-36996 (5.3 medium) Information Disclosure of user names
  17. SVD-2024-0717 CVE-2024-36997 (4.6 medium) Persistent Cross-site Scripting (XSS) in conf-web/settings REST endpoint
  18. SVD-2024-0718 Third-Party Package Updates in Splunk Enterprise - July 2024 (23 vulnerabilities, unknown exploitation and CVSS score statuses)

No mention of exploitation. h/t for @cR0w for the last 2 CVE IDs (I relied specifically on the RSS feed entries).

updated 2024-07-01T18:32:41

2 posts

In Splunk Enterprise versions below 9.2.2, 9.1.5, and 9.0.10 and Splunk Cloud Platform versions below 9.1.2312.200, a low-privileged user that does not hold the admin or power Splunk roles could create notifications in Splunk Web Bulletin Messages that all users on the instance receive.

##

CVE-2024-21461
(8.4 HIGH)

EPSS: 0.04%

updated 2024-07-01T15:32:43

4 posts

Memory corruption while performing finish HMAC operation when context is freed by keymaster.

1 repos

#search_error

screaminggoat at 2024-07-02T16:46:05.481Z ##

Qualcomm security advisory: July 2024 Security Bulletin
I mentioned Qualcomm yesterday in the Android security advisory toot, here's their July 2024 security bulletin. The critical rated CVE-2024-21461 is a CVSSv3.1 8.4 high severity vulnerability in reality: Double Free in HLOS, Memory corruption while performing finish HMAC operation when context is freed by keymaster. 6 vulnerabilities of varying severities. No mention of exploitation

#qualcomm #vulnerability #CVE

##
screaminggoat at 2024-07-01T19:06:29.760Z ##

Google Android security advisory: Android Security BulletinJuly 2024
29 security vulnerabilities, CVE-2024-31320 (EoP) is marked critical severity. Qualcomm vuln CVE-2024-21461 is also critical. 25 vulnerabilities of varying types are high severity. No mention of exploitation

  • Pixel does not have a July 2024 Bulletin
  • There are no Android Automotive OS security patches in the July 2024 Android Automotive OS Update Bulletin.
  • Chromecast does not have a July 2024 Bulletin
  • Wear July 2024 bulletin is 404 error.
  • Pixel Watch does not have a July 2024 Bulletin

#PatchTuesday #Google #Android #vulnerability #CVE

  • Wear July 2024 bulletin is 404 error.
  • Pixel Watch does not have a July 2024 Bulletin

##

CVE-2006-5051
(8.1 HIGH)

EPSS: 79.14%

updated 2024-07-01T11:15:03.427000

14 posts

Signal handler race condition in OpenSSH before 4.4 allows remote attackers to cause a denial of service (crash), and possibly execute arbitrary code if GSSAPI authentication is enabled, via unspecified vectors that lead to a double-free.

2 repos

https://github.com/sardine-web/CVE-2024-6387_Check

https://github.com/bigb0x/CVE-2024-6387

jbz@indieweb.social at 2024-07-01T16:45:06.000Z ##

'Critical' vulnerability in OpenSSH uncovered, affects almost all Linux systems

They have named this vulnerability "regreSSHion", since it represents the re-emergence of a bug that was previously patched in 2006 (CVE-2006-5051). It is described as "critical"

#OpenSSH #regreSSHion #CVE20065051 #SSH #Vulnerability #Infosec #Opensource
https://www.computing.co.uk/news/4329906/critical-vulnerability-openssh-uncovered-affects-linux-systems

##
jbz@indieweb.social at 2024-07-01T16:45:06.000Z ##

'Critical' vulnerability in OpenSSH uncovered, affects almost all Linux systems

They have named this vulnerability "regreSSHion", since it represents the re-emergence of a bug that was previously patched in 2006 (CVE-2006-5051). It is described as "critical"

'Critical' vulnerability in OpenSSH uncovered, affects almost all Linux systems

They have named this vulnerability "regreSSHion", since it represents the re-emergence of a bug that was previously patched in 2006 (CVE-2006-5051). It is described as "critical"

#OpenSSH #regreSSHion #CVE20065051 #SSH #Vulnerability #Infosec #Opensource
https://www.computing.co.uk/news/4329906/critical-vulnerability-openssh-uncovered-affects-linux-systems

##
magi@mastodon.uno at 2024-07-03T04:58:45.000Z ##

Scoperta vulnerabilit critica in OpenSSH che colpisce quasi tutti i sistemi Linux
#linux #OpenSSH #CVE #UnoLinux
stata recentemente rilevata la vulnerabilit CVE-2024-6387 che interessa OpenSSH, software per la creazione di sessioni di comunicazione crittografate tramite il protocollo Secure Shell. Tale vulnerabilit correlata alla CVE-2006-5051 potrebbe consentire a un utente malintenzionato remoto lesecuzione di codice arbitrario sui dispositivi interessati.

https://www.marcosbox.com/2024/07/03/scoperta-vulnerabilita-critica-in-openssh-che-colpisce-quasi-tutti-i-sistemi-linux/

##
cyberkillen@swecyb.com at 2024-07-02T05:11:48.000Z ##

https://www.darkreading.com/cloud-security/regresshion-bug-threatens-takeover-of-millions-of-linux-systems

(CVE-2006-5051) #regresshion

##
screaminggoat at 2024-07-01T13:38:08.837Z ##

OpenSSH security advisory: regreSSHion: RCE in OpenSSH's server, on glibc-based Linux systems (CVE-2024-6387)
CVE-2024-6387 (people are calling this critical without knowing what the CVSS score is) is referred to as #regreSSHion (cc: @shellsharks). Currently trending on social media due to it being dropped this morning.
a signal handler race condition in OpenSSH's server (sshd). if a client does not authenticate within LoginGraceTime seconds (120 by default) This race condition affects sshd in its default configuration. "This vulnerability is exploitable remotely on glibc-based Linux systems ... an unauthenticated remote code execution as root"
This vulnerability is a regression of CVE-2006-5051 (9.3 high) "Signal handler race condition in OpenSSH before 4.4 allows remote attackers to cause a denial of service (crash), and possibly execute arbitrary code"

#CVE_2024_6387 #openssh

##
briankrebs at 2024-07-01T12:31:54.923Z ##

In case your Monday wasn't stressful enough already, there's a lot of chatter about a newly documented remote code execution vulnerability (CVE-2024-6387) in OpenSSH server.

"Based on searches using Censys and Shodan, we have identified over 14 million potentially vulnerable OpenSSH server instances exposed to the Internet. Anonymized data from Qualys CSAM 3.0 with External Attack Surface Management data reveals that approximately 700,000 external internet-facing instances are vulnerable. This accounts for 31% of all internet-facing instances with OpenSSH in our global customer base. Interestingly, over 0.14% of vulnerable internet-facing instances with OpenSSH service have an End-Of-Life/End-Of-Support version of OpenSSH running."

...."The vulnerability, which is a signal handler race condition in OpenSSH's server (sshd), allows unauthenticated remote code execution (RCE) as root on glibc-based Linux systems."

"In our security analysis, we identified that this vulnerability is a regression of the previously patched vulnerability CVE-2006-5051, which was reported in 2006."

https://blog.qualys.com/vulnerabilities-threat-research/2024/07/01/regresshion-remote-unauthenticated-code-execution-vulnerability-in-openssh-server

##
magi@mastodon.uno at 2024-07-03T04:58:45.000Z ##

Scoperta vulnerabilit critica in OpenSSH che colpisce quasi tutti i sistemi Linux
#linux #OpenSSH #CVE #UnoLinux
stata recentemente rilevata la vulnerabilit CVE-2024-6387 che interessa OpenSSH, software per la creazione di sessioni di comunicazione crittografate tramite il protocollo Secure Shell. Tale vulnerabilit correlata alla CVE-2006-5051 potrebbe consentire a un utente malintenzionato remoto lesecuzione di codice arbitrario sui dispositivi interessati.

https://www.marcosbox.com/2024/07/03/scoperta-vulnerabilita-critica-in-openssh-che-colpisce-quasi-tutti-i-sistemi-linux/

##
cyberkillen@swecyb.com at 2024-07-02T05:11:48.000Z ##

https://www.darkreading.com/cloud-security/regresshion-bug-threatens-takeover-of-millions-of-linux-systems

(CVE-2006-5051) #regresshion

##
screaminggoat@infosec.exchange at 2024-07-01T13:38:08.000Z ##

OpenSSH security advisory: regreSSHion: RCE in OpenSSH's server, on glibc-based Linux systems (CVE-2024-6387)
CVE-2024-6387 (people are calling this critical without knowing what the CVSS score is) is referred to as #regreSSHion (cc: @shellsharks). Currently trending on social media due to it being dropped this morning.
a signal handler race condition in OpenSSH's server (sshd). if a client does not authenticate within LoginGraceTime seconds (120 by default) This race condition affects sshd in its default configuration. "This vulnerability is exploitable remotely on glibc-based Linux systems ... an unauthenticated remote code execution as root"
This vulnerability is a regression of CVE-2006-5051 (9.3 high) "Signal handler race condition in OpenSSH before 4.4 allows remote attackers to cause a denial of service (crash), and possibly execute arbitrary code"

#CVE_2024_6387 #openssh

##
briankrebs@infosec.exchange at 2024-07-01T12:31:54.000Z ##

In case your Monday wasn't stressful enough already, there's a lot of chatter about a newly documented remote code execution vulnerability (CVE-2024-6387) in OpenSSH server.

"Based on searches using Censys and Shodan, we have identified over 14 million potentially vulnerable OpenSSH server instances exposed to the Internet. Anonymized data from Qualys CSAM 3.0 with External Attack Surface Management data reveals that approximately 700,000 external internet-facing instances are vulnerable. This accounts for 31% of all internet-facing instances with OpenSSH in our global customer base. Interestingly, over 0.14% of vulnerable internet-facing instances with OpenSSH service have an End-Of-Life/End-Of-Support version of OpenSSH running."

...."The vulnerability, which is a signal handler race condition in OpenSSH's server (sshd), allows unauthenticated remote code execution (RCE) as root on glibc-based Linux systems."

"In our security analysis, we identified that this vulnerability is a regression of the previously patched vulnerability CVE-2006-5051, which was reported in 2006."

https://blog.qualys.com/vulnerabilities-threat-research/2024/07/01/regresshion-remote-unauthenticated-code-execution-vulnerability-in-openssh-server

##
decio@infosec.exchange at 2024-07-01T09:44:57.000Z ##

But that's not like me, I'm breaking free
-- The Interrupters, "Haven't Seen the Last of Me"

"This vulnerability is exploitable remotely on glibc-based Linux systems,
where syslog() itself calls async-signal-unsafe functions (for example,
malloc() and free()): an unauthenticated remote code execution as root,
because it affects sshd's privileged code, which is not sandboxed and
runs with full privileges. We have not investigated any other libc or
operating system; but OpenBSD is notably not vulnerable, because its
SIGALRM handler calls syslog_r(), an async-signal-safer version of
syslog() that was invented by OpenBSD in 2001.

To exploit this vulnerability remotely (to the best of our knowledge,
CVE-2006-5051 has never been successfully exploited before), we drew
inspiration from a visionary paper, "Delivering Signals for Fun and
Profit", which was published in 2001 by Michal Zalewski"

https://www.qualys.com/2024/07/01/cve-2024-6387/regresshion.txt

#Debian :debian: tracker

https://security-tracker.debian.org/tracker/CVE-2024-6387

#CyberVeille #cve_2024_6387

##
H3liumb0y@infosec.exchange at 2024-07-01T09:40:22.000Z ##

regreSSHion: Remote Code Execution in OpenSSH Server (CVE-2024-6387)

Date: July 1, 2024

CVE: CVE-2024-6387

Vulnerability Type: Race Condition

CWE: [[CWE-362]], [[CWE-665]]

Sources: Qualys

Synopsis

A critical remote code execution (RCE) vulnerability has been identified in OpenSSH's server on glibc-based Linux systems, allowing unauthenticated attackers to execute arbitrary code as root.

Issue Summary

The vulnerability, identified as CVE-2024-6387, is a regression of a previously patched issue (CVE-2006-5051) and affects OpenSSH versions from 8.5p1 to 9.8p1. It arises from a signal handler race condition in the sshd server, leading to unsafe function calls within asynchronous signal handlers.

Technical Key Findings

The flaw involves sshd's SIGALRM handler, which calls non-async-signal-safe functions like syslog(), potentially leading to a heap corruption and enabling remote code execution. The exploit requires precise timing to interrupt specific code paths, leaving the system in an inconsistent state that can be exploited.

Vulnerable Products

  • OpenSSH versions 8.5p1 to 9.8p1 on glibc-based Linux systems.

Impact Assessment

Exploitation of this vulnerability allows an attacker to execute arbitrary code as root on affected systems, potentially leading to complete system compromise.

Patches or Workaround

A fix has been implemented in OpenSSH by moving the async-signal-unsafe code to a synchronous context. Users are advised to update to the latest version or set LoginGraceTime to 0 as a temporary mitigation.

Tags

#OpenSSH #CVE-2024-6387 #RCE #RaceCondition #Linux #glibc #SecurityVulnerability #Exploit #Patch

CVE-2024-23692
(9.8 CRITICAL)

EPSS: 0.21%

updated 2024-06-28T04:15:04.597000

12 posts

Rejetto HTTP File Server, up to and including version 2.3m, is vulnerable to a template injection vulnerability. This vulnerability allows a remote, unauthenticated attacker to execute arbitrary commands on the affected system by sending a specially crafted HTTP request. As of the CVE assignment date, Rejetto HFS 2.3m is no longer supported.

Nuclei template

##
taylorparizo at 2024-07-05T15:36:32.901Z ##

This is a destructive OPSEC failure.
PoC code is trivial to find along with a simple Censys query to uncover vulnerable hosts. The code itself supports a TXT file of URLs so....spray and pray method to find targets. Certain campaigns used #XMRig, GoThief, and backdoors like #Gh0stRAT and #PlugX.

It should go without saying to not make your file servers open to the public but some didn't get the memo.
#HFS #CVE202423692 #ThreatIntel

https://asec.ahnlab.com/en/67650/

AAKL@infosec.exchange at 2024-07-03T17:21:47.000Z ##

IBM advisory:

- CVE-2024-37532: IBM WebSphere Application Server shipped with IBM DevOps Code ClearCase https://www.ibm.com/support/pages/node/7159592

- CVE-2024-35153: WebSphere Application Server shipped with IBM Tivoli System Automation Application Manager https://www.ibm.com/support/pages/node/7159498 #cybersecurity #infosec

##
AAKL@infosec.exchange at 2024-07-02T14:57:31.000Z ##

New #IBM security advisories:

- Disabled USB port vulnerability affects IBM FlashSystem 5300 - CVE-2024-39723 https://www.ibm.com/support/pages/node/7159333

Yikes.

- IBM Observability with Instana (OnPrem) is affected by Multiple Security Vulnerabilities - CVE-2023-43804; CVE-2024-29025; CVE-2023-44487; CVE-2024-23450; CVE-2023-2454; CVE-2023-5072; CVE-2023-39417; CVE-2023-5869; CVE-2023-36478; CVE-2024-0985; CVE-2024-26308; CVE-2024-25710 https://www.ibm.com/support/pages/node/7158633

- WebSphere Application Server shipped with IBM Security Guardium Key Lifecycle Manager - CVE-2024-35153 https://www.ibm.com/support/pages/node/7159502

- IBM PowerVM Novalink: jose4j denial of service vulnerability caused by improper input validation - CVE-2023-51775 https://www.ibm.com/support/pages/node/7159508

- BM WebSphere Application Server Liberty 17.0.0.3 through 24.0.0.5 are vulnerable to an XML External Entity Injection - CVE-2024-2235 https://www.ibm.com/support/pages/node/7159507 #cybersecurity #infosec

##

CVE-2024-5806
(7.4 HIGH)

EPSS: 0.04%

updated 2024-06-25T15:31:18

11 posts

Improper Authentication vulnerability in Progress MOVEit Transfer (SFTP module) can lead to Authentication Bypass in limited scenarios.This issue affects MOVEit Transfer: from 2023.0.0 before 2023.0.11, from 2023.1.0 before 2023.1.6, from 2024.0.0 before 2024.0.2.

1 repos

https://github.com/watchtowrlabs/watchTowr-vs-progress-moveit_CVE-2024-5806

catc0n at 2024-07-01T23:44:20.810Z ##

Rapid7 analysis of #MOVEit Transfer #CVE_2024_5806 c/o @stephenfewer, with an assist from @fuzz. Notably, this exploit method is different from the one published last week Rapid7's exploit achieves the auth bypass by manipulating the username supplied client-side during the SSH protocol's public key auth exchange with the server. As a result, both exploitability and IOCs are different. This also doesn't rely on what appears to be a new 0day for exploitation, though that was an interesting (if surprising) method.
https://attackerkb.com/topics/44EZLG2xgL/cve-2024-5806/rapid7-analysis

##
screaminggoat at 2024-06-25T18:29:24.293Z ##

Progress Software security advisories:

  • MOVEit Gateway Critical Security Alert Bulletin June 2024 (CVE-2024-5805): CVE-2024-5805 (9.1 critical) An Improper Authentication vulnerability in Progress MOVEit Gateway (SFTP module) allows Authentication Bypass.
  • MOVEit Transfer Product Security Alert Bulletin June 2024 (CVE-2024-5806): CVE-2024-5806 (7.4 high) An Improper Authentication vulnerability in Progress MOVEit Transfer (SFTP module) can lead to Authentication Bypass in limited scenarios. Proof of concept available, see parent toot above.

No mention of exploitation in the wild. Both vulnerabilities were patched. Notes:

  • MOVEit Cloud does not use MOVEit Gateway, so no further action is needed by MOVEit Cloud customers. (CVE-2024-5805)
  • Customers using theMOVEit Cloudenvironment were patched and are no longer vulnerable to this exploit. (CVE-2024-5806)

cc: @cR0w @mttaggart @campuscodi

#CVE_2024_5805 #CVE_2024_5806 #Progress #Moveit #vulnerability #CVE

##
screaminggoat at 2024-06-25T15:21:48.529Z ##

watchTowr: Auth. Bypass In (Un)Limited Scenarios - Progress MOVEit Transfer (CVE-2024-5806)
Hot off the press! cc: @cR0w @mttaggart
CVE-2024-5806 (7.4 high) Improper Authentication vulnerability in Progress MOVEit Transfer (SFTP module) can lead to Authentication Bypass in limited scenarios.
watchTowr provides additional information (and what looks like a proof of concept exploit code) in their deep dive:

The vulnerability arises from the interplay between MOVEit and IPWorks SSH, and a failure to handle an error condition.

Progress quietly emailed MOVEit customers about an "auth bypass in SFTP" around 13 June 2024. Information about CVE-2024-5806 was embargoed until today 25 June 2024.

#CVE_2024_5806 #Progress #vulnerability #CVE

##
screaminggoat@infosec.exchange at 2024-06-25T18:29:24.000Z ##

Progress Software security advisories:

  • MOVEit Gateway Critical Security Alert Bulletin June 2024 (CVE-2024-5805): CVE-2024-5805 (9.1 critical) An Improper Authentication vulnerability in Progress MOVEit Gateway (SFTP module) allows Authentication Bypass.
  • MOVEit Transfer Product Security Alert Bulletin June 2024 (CVE-2024-5806): CVE-2024-5806 (7.4 high) An Improper Authentication vulnerability in Progress MOVEit Transfer (SFTP module) can lead to Authentication Bypass in limited scenarios. Proof of concept available, see parent toot above.

No mention of exploitation in the wild. Both vulnerabilities were patched. Notes:

  • MOVEit Cloud does not use MOVEit Gateway, so no further action is needed by MOVEit Cloud customers. (CVE-2024-5805)
  • Customers using theMOVEit Cloudenvironment were patched and are no longer vulnerable to this exploit. (CVE-2024-5806)

updated 2024-06-21T22:15:10.750000

2 posts

Netty is an asynchronous event-driven network application framework for rapid development of maintainable high performance protocol servers & clients. The `HttpPostRequestDecoder` can be tricked to accumulate data. While the decoder can store items on the disk if configured so, there are no limits to the number of fields the form can have, an attacher can send a chunked post consisting of many sma

##

CVE-2023-44487
(5.3 MEDIUM)

EPSS: 73.19%

updated 2024-06-21T21:34:00

5 posts

## HTTP/2 Rapid reset attack The HTTP/2 protocol allows clients to indicate to the server that a previous stream should be canceled by sending a RST_STREAM frame. The protocol does not require the client and server to coordinate the cancellation in any way, the client may do it unilaterally. The client may also assume that the cancellation will take effect immediately when the server receives the

13 repos

https://github.com/studiogangster/CVE-2023-44487

https://github.com/bcdannyboy/CVE-2023-44487

https://github.com/ByteHackr/CVE-2023-44487

https://github.com/pabloec20/rapidreset

https://github.com/ReToCode/golang-CVE-2023-44487

https://github.com/ndrscodes/http2-rst-stream-attacker

https://github.com/sn130hk/CVE-2023-44487

https://github.com/secengjeff/rapidresetclient

https://github.com/terrorist/HTTP-2-Rapid-Reset-Client

https://github.com/imabee101/CVE-2023-44487

https://github.com/nxenon/cve-2023-44487

https://github.com/TYuan0816/cve-2023-44487

https://github.com/sigridou/CVE-2023-44487-

##
laozhoubuluo@dvd.chat at 2024-07-01T15:42:09.312Z ##

CentOS 7 

CentOS 7 is the real security hero this week! 
 cURL too old for CVE-2023-38545
 glibc too old for CVE-2023-4911 / Looney Tunables
 httpd too old for CVE-2023-44487 or any HTTP/2 support

https://x.com/faker_/status/1712012931381047360

RE: https://dvd.chat/notes/9v6ojfjmqcb212k1

##
AAKL@infosec.exchange at 2024-07-05T14:26:20.000Z ##

#IBM has listed 16 vulnerabilities related to its MQ container software: https://www.ibm.com/support/pages/bulletin/ #cybersecurity #Infosec

CVE-2023-36478
(7.5 HIGH)

EPSS: 0.40%

updated 2024-06-21T21:33:57

2 posts

An integer overflow in `MetaDataBuilder.checkSize` allows for HTTP/2 HPACK header values to exceed their size limit. CVE-2024-0985
(8.0 HIGH)

EPSS: 0.05%

updated 2024-06-20T00:15:09.260000

2 posts

Late privilege drop in REFRESH MATERIALIZED VIEW CONCURRENTLY in PostgreSQL allows an object creator to execute arbitrary SQL functions as the command issuer. The command intends to run SQL functions as the owner of the materialized view, enabling safe refresh of untrusted materialized views. The victim is a superuser or member of one of the attacker's roles. The attack requires luring the victim

CVE-2024-34447(CVSS UNKNOWN)

EPSS: 0.04%

updated 2024-06-14T15:32:27

2 posts

An issue was discovered in Bouncy Castle Java Cryptography APIs before BC 1.78. When endpoint identification is enabled in the BCJSSE and an SSL socket is created without an explicit hostname (as happens with HttpsURLConnection), hostname verification could be performed against a DNS-resolved IP address in some situations, opening up a possibility of DNS poisoning.

##

CVE-2024-21412
(8.1 HIGH)

EPSS: 0.23%

updated 2024-06-11T15:16:02.980000

8 posts

Internet Shortcut Files Security Feature Bypass Vulnerability

1 repos

https://github.com/lsr00ter/CVE-2024-21412_Water-Hydra

screaminggoat at 2024-07-05T13:40:02.187Z ##

Cyble: Increase in the exploitation of Microsoft SmartScreen vulnerability CVE-2024-21412
Cyble warns of an active campaign exploiting the Microsoft SmartScreen vulnerability CVE-2024-21412 (8.1 high, disclosed 13 February 2024 by Microsoft as an exploited zero-day). Targets are currently Spain, Australia and the U.S., using lures related to healthcare insurance schemes, transportation notices, and tax-related communications. This campaign delivers Lumma and Meduza Stealer as its final payloads. IOC and Yara rule provided.

#threatintel #CVE_2024_21412 #infostealer #lummac2 #meduza #ioc

##
screaminggoat at 2024-06-28T21:36:30.284Z ##

SonicWall: A Deep Dive Into DarkME Rat Malware
SonicWall provides a technical analysis of DarkME RAT malware. They only mention CVE-2024-21412 once: It is a Microsoft Windows Internet Shortcut Files Security Feature Bypass Vulnerability (CVSSv3.1: 8.1 high severity) leveraged by the financially motivated Water Hydra (DarkCasino) APT during a a spike in DarkME RAT distribution in February 2024. While SonicWall describes the infection chain and the RAT's features, they do NOT provide IOC. I'm not going to handjam the SHA256 from a VirusTotal screenshot.

#Darkme #DarkGate #WaterHydra #DarkCasino #APT #malwareanalysis #CVE_2024_21412 #threatintel

##

Targets are currently Spain, Australia and the U.S., using lures related to healthcare insurance schemes, transportation notices, and tax-related communications. This campaign delivers Lumma and Meduza Stealer as its final payloads. IOC and Yara rule provided.

##

CVE-2024-20666
(6.6 MEDIUM)

EPSS: 0.05%

updated 2024-06-11T15:15:56.487000

2 posts

BitLocker Security Feature Bypass Vulnerability

2 repos

https://github.com/nnotwen/Script-For-CVE-2024-20666

https://github.com/invaderslabs/CVE-2024-20666

avoidthehack at 2024-07-01T19:25:14.473Z ##

Fake #IT support sites push malicious #PowerShell scripts as #Windows fixes

Threat actors are creating fake tech support sites, promoting them via compromised YouTube creator accounts. These fake sites instruct users to run (malicious) PowerShell scripts that call information-stealing malware.

Specifically, threat actors are targeting the Windows 0x80070643 error introduced after #Microsoft addressed a BitLocker encryption bypass flaw (tracked as CVE-2024-20666) - affected users are actively searching for fixes, which may lead to stumbling upon these fake sites.

#security #cybersecurity

https://www.bleepingcomputer.com/news/security/fake-it-support-sites-push-malicious-powershell-scripts-as-windows-fixes/

##
avoidthehack@infosec.exchange at 2024-07-01T19:25:14.000Z ##

Fake #IT support sites push malicious #PowerShell scripts as #Windows fixes

Threat actors are creating fake tech support sites, promoting them via compromised YouTube creator accounts. These fake sites instruct users to run (malicious) PowerShell scripts that call information-stealing malware.

Specifically, threat actors are targeting the Windows 0x80070643 error introduced after #Microsoft addressed a BitLocker encryption bypass flaw (tracked as CVE-2024-20666) - affected users are actively searching for fixes, which may lead to stumbling upon these fake sites.

#security #cybersecurity

https://www.bleepingcomputer.com/news/security/fake-it-support-sites-push-malicious-powershell-scripts-as-windows-fixes/

##

CVE-2023-38408
(9.8 CRITICAL)

EPSS: 2.75%

updated 2024-04-19T05:07:56

2 posts

The PKCS#11 feature in ssh-agent in OpenSSH before 9.3p2 has an insufficiently trustworthy search path, leading to remote code execution if an agent is forwarded to an attacker-controlled system. (Code in /usr/lib is not necessarily safe for loading into ssh-agent.) NOTE: this issue exists because of an incomplete fix for CVE-2016-10009.

4 repos

https://github.com/wxrdnx/CVE-2023-38408

https://github.com/kali-mx/CVE-2023-38408

https://github.com/LucasPDiniz/CVE-2023-38408

https://github.com/classic130/CVE-2023-38408

ckure at 2024-07-02T03:00:00.659Z ##

@4Dgifts @wdormann I think log4j just from the bonkers exploitability surface area. Somebody just drops some jndi string into a device name or form field and some system far removed just goes to grab some Java class & runs it. I also really liked the creativity in CVE-2023-38408 (OpenSSH ssh-agent RCE); but if the Qualys folks write anything up, it just makes me smile.

##
ckure@infosec.exchange at 2024-07-02T03:00:00.000Z ##

@4Dgifts @wdormann I think log4j just from the bonkers exploitability surface area. Somebody just drops some jndi string into a device name or form field and some system far removed just goes to grab some Java class & runs it. I also really liked the creativity in CVE-2023-38408 (OpenSSH ssh-agent RCE); but if the Qualys folks write anything up, it just makes me smile.

CVE-2024-31204
(6.1 MEDIUM)

EPSS: 0.04%

updated 2024-04-05T12:40:52.763000

2 posts

mailcow: dockerized is an open source groupware/email suite based on docker. A security vulnerability has been identified in mailcow affecting versions prior to 2024-04. This vulnerability resides in the exception handling mechanism, specifically when not operating in DEV_MODE. The system saves exception details into a session array without proper sanitization or encoding. These details are later

screaminggoat at 2024-07-02T13:39:39.844Z ##

SecureLayer7: Major Security Flaws in Mailcow: Inside the XSS and Path Traversal Exploits (CVE-2024-31204 and CVE-2024-30270)
Mailcow is an open source mail server software suite. CVE-2024-31204 (6.1 medium) XSS in the Admin Panel and CVE-2024-30270 (6.2 medium) arbitrary file overwrite were originally reported by SonarSource. SecureLayer7 performs patch diffing to provide a root cause analysis (proof of concept) for them.

#vulnerability #CVE_2024_31204 #CVE_2024_30270 #mailcow #proofofconcept #CVE

##
screaminggoat@infosec.exchange at 2024-07-02T13:39:39.000Z ##

SecureLayer7: Major Security Flaws in Mailcow: Inside the XSS and Path Traversal Exploits (CVE-2024-31204 and CVE-2024-30270)
Mailcow is an open source mail server software suite. CVE-2024-31204 (6.1 medium) XSS in the Admin Panel and CVE-2024-30270 (6.2 medium) arbitrary file overwrite were originally reported by SonarSource. SecureLayer7 performs patch diffing to provide a root cause analysis (proof of concept) for them.

#vulnerability #CVE_2024_31204 #CVE_2024_30270 #mailcow #proofofconcept #CVE

##

CVE-2023-4807
(7.8 HIGH)

EPSS: 0.04%

updated 2024-04-04T07:34:06

4 posts

Issue summary: The POLY1305 MAC (message authentication code) implementation contains a bug that might corrupt the internal state of applications on the Windows 64 platform when running on newer X86_64 processors supporting the AVX512-IFMA instructions. Impact summary: If in an application that uses the OpenSSL library an attacker can influence whether the POLY1305 MAC algorithm is used, the appl

##

CVE-2023-38545
(9.8 CRITICAL)

EPSS: 0.32%

updated 2024-04-01T15:45:40.907000

1 posts

This flaw makes curl overflow a heap based buffer in the SOCKS5 proxy handshake. When curl is asked to pass along the host name to the SOCKS5 proxy to allow that to resolve the address instead of it getting done by curl itself, the maximum length that host name can be is 255 bytes. If the host name is detected to be longer, curl switches to local name resolving and instead passes on the resolved

https://github.com/fatmo666/CVE-2023-38545-libcurl-SOCKS5-heap-buffer-overflow

https://github.com/nphuang/NS-Project-2024-Spring

https://github.com/vanigori/CVE-2023-38545-sample

https://github.com/bcdannyboy/CVE-2023-38545

https://github.com/UTsweetyfish/CVE-2023-38545

https://github.com/d0rb/CVE-2023-38545

https://github.com/dbrugman/CVE-2023-38545-POC

##

CVE-2024-3094
(10.0 CRITICAL)

EPSS: 14.71%

updated 2024-03-29T18:30:50

2 posts

Malicious code was discovered in the upstream tarballs of xz, starting with version 5.6.0. The tarballs included extra .m4 files, which contained instructions for building with automake that did not exist in the repository. These instructions, through a series of complex obfuscations, extract a prebuilt object file from one of the test archives, which is then used to modify specific functions in t

Nuclei template

decio at 2024-07-02T08:01:53.051Z ##

Rsum de l'impact de la vuln CVE-2024-6387 par distribution :linux:

  • Debian :debian: :

Debian 11 : non impact ;
Debian 12 : sont vulnrables les versions OpenSSH infrieures strictement 1:9.2p1-deb12u3 ;
Debian SID : sont vulnrables les versions OpenSSH infrieures strictement 1:9.7p1-7.

https://security-tracker.debian.org/tracker/CVE-2024-6387

  • Alpine Linux Edge :alpinelinux: :
    xz-utils versions infrieures 5.6.1-r2

    https://security.alpinelinux.org/vuln/CVE-2024-3094

  • ArchLinux :archlinux: :
    Sont vulnrables les versions OpenSSH infrieures strictement 9.8p1-1.

    https://security.archlinux.org/ASA-202407-1

  • Oracle Linux :
    Oracle Linux 6 : non impact ;
    Oracle Linux 7 : non impact ;
    Oracle Linux 8 : non impact ;
    Oracle Linux 9 : sont vulnrables les versions OpenSSH infrieures strictement 8.7p1-38.0.2.el9.

    https://linux.oracle.com/errata/ELSA-2024-12468.html

  • Red Hat :redhat: :
    RHEL 6 : non impact ;
    RHEL 7 : non impact ;
    RHEL 8 : non impact ;
    RHEL 9 : toutes les versions sont vulnrables (correctif en cours de prparation).

    https://access.redhat.com/security/cve/cve-2024-6387

  • Ubuntu :ubuntu: :
    Ubuntu 22.04 : sont vulnrables les versions OpenSSH infrieures strictement 1:8.9p1-3ubuntu0.10 ;
    Ubuntu 23.10 :sont vulnrables les versions OpenSSH infrieures strictement 1:9.3p1-1ubuntu3.6 ;
    Ubuntu 24.04 : sont vulnrables les versions OpenSSH infrieures strictement 1:9.6p1-3ubuntu13.3.

    https://ubuntu.com/security/notices/USN-6859-1

Mitigation possible avec Fail2Ban & co et selon RedHat

"Ce problme peut tre rsolu en dfinissant le paramtre LoginGraceTime 0 dans le fichier de configuration de sshd.
1) En tant qu'utilisateur root, ouvrez le fichier /etc/ssh/sshd_config
2) Ajoutez ou modifiez la configuration du paramtre :
LoginGraceTime 0
3) Sauvegardez et fermez le fichier
4) Redmarrez le dmon sshd :
systemctl restart sshd.service
Notez que le serveur sshd sera toujours vulnrable aux attaques par dni de service en raison de la possibilit d'puisement des connexions MaxStartups, mais qu'il sera protg contre les ventuelles attaques par excution de code distance."

Bon rsum en FR

https://cyberwatch.fr/cve/cve-2024-6387-regresshion-detectez-et-corrigez-cette-vulnerabilite-sur-openssh/

Pour les "objets connects" exposs a va tre dur, dur

#CyberVeille #CVE_2024_6387

##
decio@infosec.exchange at 2024-07-02T08:01:53.000Z ##

Rsum de l'impact de la vuln CVE-2024-6387 par distribution :linux:

  • Debian :debian: :

Debian 11 : non impact ;
Debian 12 : sont vulnrables les versions OpenSSH infrieures strictement 1:9.2p1-deb12u3 ;
Debian SID : sont vulnrables les versions OpenSSH infrieures strictement 1:9.7p1-7.

https://security-tracker.debian.org/tracker/CVE-2024-6387

  • Alpine Linux Edge :alpinelinux: :
    xz-utils versions infrieures 5.6.1-r2

    https://security.alpinelinux.org/vuln/CVE-2024-3094

  • ArchLinux :archlinux: :
    Sont vulnrables les versions OpenSSH infrieures strictement 9.8p1-1.

    https://security.archlinux.org/ASA-202407-1

  • Oracle Linux :
    Oracle Linux 6 : non impact ;
    Oracle Linux 7 : non impact ;
    Oracle Linux 8 : non impact ;
    Oracle Linux 9 : sont vulnrables les versions OpenSSH infrieures strictement 8.7p1-38.0.2.el9.

    https://linux.oracle.com/errata/ELSA-2024-12468.html

  • Red Hat :redhat: :
    RHEL 6 : non impact ;
    RHEL 7 : non impact ;
    RHEL 8 : non impact ;
    RHEL 9 : toutes les versions sont vulnrables (correctif en cours de prparation).

    https://access.redhat.com/security/cve/cve-2024-6387

  • Ubuntu :ubuntu: :
    Ubuntu 22.04 : sont vulnrables les versions OpenSSH infrieures strictement 1:8.9p1-3ubuntu0.10 ;
    Ubuntu 23.10 :sont vulnrables les versions OpenSSH infrieures strictement 1:9.3p1-1ubuntu3.6 ;
    Ubuntu 24.04 : sont vulnrables les versions OpenSSH infrieures strictement 1:9.6p1-3ubuntu13.3.

    https://ubuntu.com/security/notices/USN-6859-1

Mitigation possible avec Fail2Ban & co et selon RedHat

"Ce problme peut tre rsolu en dfinissant le paramtre LoginGraceTime 0 dans le fichier de configuration de sshd.
1) En tant qu'utilisateur root, ouvrez le fichier /etc/ssh/sshd_config
2) Ajoutez ou modifiez la configuration du paramtre :
LoginGraceTime 0
3) Sauvegardez et fermez le fichier
4) Redmarrez le dmon sshd :
systemctl restart sshd.service
Notez que le serveur sshd sera toujours vulnrable aux attaques par dni de service en raison de la possibilit d'puisement des connexions MaxStartups, mais qu'il sera protg contre les ventuelles attaques par excution de code distance."

Bon rsum en FR

https://cyberwatch.fr/cve/cve-2024-6387-regresshion-detectez-et-corrigez-cette-vulnerabilite-sur-openssh/

Pour les "objets connects" exposs a va tre dur, dur

CVE-2024-26308
(7.5 HIGH)

EPSS: 0.06%

updated 2024-03-07T18:30:28

2 posts

Allocation of Resources Without Limits or Throttling vulnerability in Apache Commons Compress. This issue affects Apache Commons Compress: from 1.21 before 1.26. Users are recommended to upgrade to version 1.26, which fixes the issue.

- Disabled USB port vulnerability affects IBM FlashSystem 5300 - CVE-2024-39723 https://www.ibm.com/support/pages/node/7159333

Yikes.

- IBM Observability with Instana (OnPrem) is affected by Multiple Security Vulnerabilities - CVE-2023-43804; CVE-2024-29025; CVE-2023-44487; CVE-2024-23450; CVE-2023-2454; CVE-2023-5072; CVE-2023-39417; CVE-2023-5869; CVE-2023-36478; CVE-2024-0985; CVE-2024-26308; CVE-2024-25710 https://www.ibm.com/support/pages/node/7158633

- IBM PowerVM Novalink: jose4j denial of service vulnerability caused by improper input validation - CVE-2023-51775 https://www.ibm.com/support/pages/node/7159508

##

CVE-2023-39417
(7.5 HIGH)

EPSS: 0.14%

updated 2024-02-25T05:08:04

2 posts

IN THE EXTENSION SCRIPT, a SQL Injection vulnerability was found in PostgreSQL if it uses @extowner@, @extschema@, or @extschema:...@ inside a quoting construct (dollar quoting, '', or ""). If an administrator has installed files of a vulnerable, trusted, non-bundled extension, an attacker with database-level CREATE privilege can execute arbitrary code as the bootstrap superuser.

CVE-2023-4911
(7.8 HIGH)

EPSS: 1.59%

updated 2024-02-22T20:18:58.020000

1 posts

A buffer overflow was discovered in the GNU C Library's dynamic loader ld.so while processing the GLIBC_TUNABLES environment variable. This issue could allow a local attacker to use maliciously crafted GLIBC_TUNABLES environment variables when launching binaries with SUID permission to execute code with elevated privileges.

CVE-2024-0769
(5.3 MEDIUM)

EPSS: 0.21%

updated 2024-01-21T09:30:39

2 posts

** UNSUPPORTED WHEN ASSIGNED ** A vulnerability was found in D-Link DIR-859 1.06B01. It has been rated as critical. Affected by this issue is some unknown functionality of the file /hedwig.cgi of the component HTTP POST Request Handler. The manipulation of the argument service with the input ../../../../htdocs/webinc/getcfg/DHCPS6.BRIDGE-1.xml leads to path traversal. The attack may be launched re

avoidthehack at 2024-07-01T20:55:12.408Z ##

#Hackers exploit critical D-Link DIR-859 router flaw to steal passwords

Threat actors are using slight variations of the publicly available exploit code for CVE-2024-0769 to extract account details from the router.

This could lead to compromise of the router.

Note: this particular router model has reached end-of-life according to D-Link.

This highlights the importance of not using end-of-life devices or software where possible. Depending on the router model, when it is end-of-life, you may be able to flash it with opensource firmware to extend its life. This isn't always possible, though, and users are advised to get a new(er) device ASAP.

#security #cybersecurity #cve

https://www.bleepingcomputer.com/news/security/hackers-exploit-critical-d-link-dir-859-router-flaw-to-steal-passwords/

##
avoidthehack@infosec.exchange at 2024-07-01T20:55:12.000Z ##

#Hackers exploit critical D-Link DIR-859 router flaw to steal passwords

Threat actors are using slight variations of the publicly available exploit code for CVE-2024-0769 to extract account details from the router.

This could lead to compromise of the router.

Note: this particular router model has reached end-of-life according to D-Link.

This highlights the importance of not using end-of-life devices or software where possible. Depending on the router model, when it is end-of-life, you may be able to flash it with opensource firmware to extend its life. This isn't always possible, though, and users are advised to get a new(er) device ASAP.

#security #cybersecurity #cve

- chroma sub-sampling destroys bright colors

urllib3 doesn't treat the `Cookie` HTTP header special or provide any helpers for managing cookies over HTTP, that is the responsibility of the user. Certain 5400 RPM hard drives, for laptops and other PCs in approximately 2005 and later, allow physically proximate attackers to cause a denial of service (device malfunction and system crash) via a resonant-frequency attack with the audio signal from the Rhythm Nation music video. - IBM Observability with Instana (OnPrem) is affected by Multiple Security Vulnerabilities - CVE-2023-43804; CVE-2024-29025; CVE-2023-44487; CVE-2024-23450; CVE-2023-2454; CVE-2023-5072; CVE-2023-39417; CVE-2023-5869; CVE-2023-36478; CVE-2024-0985; CVE-2024-26308; CVE-2024-25710 https://www.ibm.com/support/pages/node/7158633

- IBM PowerVM Novalink: jose4j denial of service vulnerability caused by improper input validation - CVE-2023-51775 https://www.ibm.com/support/pages/node/7159508

- BM WebSphere Application Server Liberty 17.0.0.3 through 24.0.0.5 are vulnerable to an XML External Entity Injection - CVE-2024-2235 https://www.ibm.com/support/pages/node/7159507 #cybersecurity #infosec

##
AAKL@infosec.exchange at 2024-07-02T14:57:31.000Z ##

- Disabled USB port vulnerability affects IBM FlashSystem 5300 - CVE-2024-39723 https://www.ibm.com/support/pages/node/7159333

Yikes.

##

CVE-2021-3781
(10.0 CRITICAL)

EPSS: 0.34%

updated 2023-07-04T05:01:26

1 posts

A trivial sandbox (enabled with the `-dSAFER` option) escape flaw was found in the ghostscript interpreter by injecting a specially crafted pipe command. This flaw allows a specially crafted document to execute arbitrary commands on the system in the context of the ghostscript interpreter. The highest threat from this vulnerability is to confidentiality, integrity, as well as system availability.

caspicat at 2024-07-04T07:15:57.031Z ##

@llimllib @hrbrmstr

Interesting, because the blog has this timeline
> 2024-05-02: Ghostscript 10.03.1 released which mitigates the issue

In the past, there were multiple 0day GS exploits in the wild. Can you confirm that it wasn't one of the old exploits like CVE-2021-3781 in your case?

https://bugs.ghostscript.com/show_bug.cgi?id=704342

##

CVE-2001-0797(CVSS UNKNOWN)

EPSS: 97.21%

updated 2023-02-01T05:00:56

2 posts

Buffer overflow in login in various System V based operating systems allows remote attackers to execute arbitrary commands via a large number of arguments through services such as telnet and rlogin.

raptor at 2024-07-02T06:01:24.690Z ##

@4Dgifts I think most qualyss exploits qualify (the stack clash?! come on). My personal favorite bug of all times remain CVE-2001-0797 (Solaris login) that sparked many cool exploits.

CVE-2005-4560(CVSS UNKNOWN)

EPSS: 97.36%

updated 2023-01-30T05:08:04

3 posts

The Windows Graphical Device Interface library (GDI32.DLL) in Microsoft Windows allows remote attackers to execute arbitrary code via a Windows Metafile (WMF) format image with a crafted SETABORTPROC GDI Escape function call, related to the Windows Picture and Fax Viewer (SHIMGVW.DLL), a different vulnerability than CVE-2005-2123 and CVE-2005-2124, and as originally discovered in the wild on union

CVE-2024-30270
(0 None)

EPSS: 0.04%

2 posts

N/A

1 repos

https://github.com/Alchemist3dot14/CVE-2024-30270-PoC

screaminggoat at 2024-07-02T13:39:39.844Z ##

SecureLayer7: Major Security Flaws in Mailcow: Inside the XSS and Path Traversal Exploits (CVE-2024-31204 and CVE-2024-30270)
Mailcow is an open source mail server software suite. CVE-2024-31204 (6.1 medium) XSS in the Admin Panel and CVE-2024-30270 (6.2 medium) arbitrary file overwrite were originally reported by SonarSource. SecureLayer7 performs patch diffing to provide a root cause analysis (proof of concept) for them.

#vulnerability #CVE_2024_31204 #CVE_2024_30270 #mailcow #proofofconcept #CVE

##
screaminggoat@infosec.exchange at 2024-07-02T13:39:39.000Z ##

SecureLayer7: Major Security Flaws in Mailcow: Inside the XSS and Path Traversal Exploits (CVE-2024-31204 and CVE-2024-30270)
Mailcow is an open source mail server software suite. CVE-2024-31204 (6.1 medium) XSS in the Admin Panel and CVE-2024-30270 (6.2 medium) arbitrary file overwrite were originally reported by SonarSource. SecureLayer7 performs patch diffing to provide a root cause analysis (proof of concept) for them.

#vulnerability #CVE_2024_31204 #CVE_2024_30270 #mailcow #proofofconcept #CVE

CVE-2024-31320
(0 None)

EPSS: 0.00%

2 posts

N/A

screaminggoat at 2024-07-01T19:06:29.760Z ##

Google Android security advisory: Android Security BulletinJuly 2024
29 security vulnerabilities, CVE-2024-31320 (EoP) is marked critical severity. Qualcomm vuln CVE-2024-21461 is also critical. 25 vulnerabilities of varying types are high severity. No mention of exploitation

  • Pixel does not have a July 2024 Bulletin
  • There are no Android Automotive OS security patches in the July 2024 Android Automotive OS Update Bulletin.
  • Chromecast does not have a July 2024 Bulletin
  • Wear July 2024 bulletin is 404 error.
  • Pixel Watch does not have a July 2024 Bulletin

#PatchTuesday #Google #Android #vulnerability #CVE

##
screaminggoat@infosec.exchange at 2024-07-01T19:06:29.000Z ##

Google Android security advisory: Android Security BulletinJuly 2024
29 security vulnerabilities, CVE-2024-31320 (EoP) is marked critical severity. Qualcomm vuln CVE-2024-21461 is also critical. 25 vulnerabilities of varying types are high severity. No mention of exploitation

  • Pixel does not have a July 2024 Bulletin
  • There are no Android Automotive OS security patches in the July 2024 Android Automotive OS Update Bulletin.
  • Chromecast does not have a July 2024 Bulletin
  • Wear July 2024 bulletin is 404 error.
  • Pixel Watch does not have a July 2024 Bulletin

#PatchTuesday #Google #Android #vulnerability #CVE
